metadata.title: CVE-2022-48663 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: gpio:mockup: fix NULL pointer dereference when removing debugfs We now removethe device's debugfs entries when unbinding the driver. This now causes aNULL-pointer dereference on module exit because the platform devices areunregistered *after* the global debugfs directory has been recursivelyremoved. Fix it by unregistering the devices first.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48663` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-1119-fips - 4.15.0-1119.130
linux-image-hmac-4.15.0-1119-fips - 4.15.0-1119.130
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1119-fips - 4.15.0-1119.130
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1119-fips - 4.15.0-1119.130
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2103-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2103.109
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2103-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2103.109
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2082-azure-fips - 4.15.0-2082.88

Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
